properties.publicTransport: Plan you trip at transportnsw.info. Visit Night at the Barracks – Getting There for details on how to get to the precinct.
properties.otherAdvice:
Night at the Barracks is back on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights at The Barracks Precinct from 15 September to 7 October.

Traffic maybe heavier than usual on event nights as attendees travel to and from the shows.

Limited parking is available nearby St Pauls High School on event nights. Motorists must pre-book a space as no casual parking will be available on the night.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of extra pedestrian activity in the area.

  • Finish 9pm

  • Start: 4:30pm
  • Finish 7pm

properties.publicTransport: Some bus services may experience delay. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place from Hyde Park North Fountain to Martin Place between approximately 4pm and 4:45pm, for a planned Police Operation.

ROLLING ROAD CLOSURES – FROM 4PM TO 4:45PM

  • Macquarie Street between Prince Albert Road and Hunter Street
  • Hunter Street between Macquarie Street and Castlereagh Street
  • Castlereagh Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place

Roads will progressively reopen when safe to do so under Police escort.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie Street, Hunter Street and Castlereagh Street

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Canley Vale and Canley Heights to Cabramatta. Regular route buses will be diverting and missing stops while roads are closed. The bus interchange at Cabramatta Station will be temporarily relocated to Railway Pde, between McBurney Rd and Hughes St. Services will start and end their trips at temporary stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the annual Cabramatta Moon Festival held on John St from 11am to 8pm on Sunday.

Heavy traffic is expected on Joseph St, Railway Pde, Cumberland Hwy and Cabramatta Rd West as crowds travel to and from the event. 

Road closures

  • From 8pm on Saturday the night before, sections of John St, Cabramatta Rd West, Park Rd and Arthur St in the Cabramatta CBD will be closed until midnight on Sunday. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.
  • From 12:01am to 11:59pm on Sunday, Railway Parade and Dutton Lane will be closed.
  • Arthur St car park will close from 12am Friday until 12pm Monday, and Hughes St car park will be closed from 8pm Saturday until 12pm Monday.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

CABRAMATTA

8pm Saturday 16 September to 4am Monday 18 September

  • John St between Hill St and Cabramatta Road West
  • Cabramatta Rd West at Railway Parade
  • Park Rd between Hughes St and John St
  • Arthur St between Park Rd and Railway Parade

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.publicTransport: Route 418 and 426 bus services will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend Dulwich Hill Festival on Marrickville Rd and Seaview St from 10am to 4pm.

Marrickville Rd will be closed between New Canterbury Rd and Durham St from 3am until 8pm. Seaview St will also be closed (managed access for residents only will be maintained via Herbert St).

Traffic will be detoured via Wardell Rd and Frazer St or Beach Rd. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on New Canterbury Rd in both directions approaching Dulwich Hill and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Route 308 buses will be diverting around Redfern St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Redfern Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, George St and Glover St will also be closed during this time.
  • Pitt St will remain open to allow traffic to cross Redfern St.
  • Motorists travelling west will be detoured via Chalmers St, Cleveland St and Regent St.
  • Motorists travelling east will be detoured via Regent St, Botany Rd and Raglan St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to visit the annual Crows Nest Fest on Willoughby Rd from 10am to 5pm.

Willoughby Rd will be closed between Falcon St and Albany St from 12:01am until 11pm Sunday.

Other local roads joining Willoughby Rd will also be closed including sections of Burlington St, Clarke St, Holtermann St, Hume Ln and Willoughby Ln.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as delays are expected on roads in the area including Ernest St, Falcon St, Chandos St and the Pacific Hwy

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Pregnancy, Babies & Children’s Expo at Sydney Showground. Start from 10am and finish 4pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic may be heavier than usual across the weekend while an event also takes place at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena. 

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Attendees driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Oz Comic-Con at Sydney Showground on Saturday and Sunday. Event runs from 9am to 5pm each day.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Attendees driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Golden Rose Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11:55am, last race from 5:25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Special event clearways will be in effect at the following times and locations:

  • 6am - 8pm: Grand Avenue from 100m east of Gate 1 to Grand Avenue North (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Surf to Turf Day – Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11:50am, last race at 5:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Spartan Race will be taking place on Saturday 16 September, as participants take place in multiple obstacle events.

There will be no right turn from Picton Rd into the event, motorists will need to detour via Maiden Bridge Rd roundabout.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place at the Maiden Bridge Rd roundabout to assist with traffic flow.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Hay Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed between Sussex St and Harbour St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber L and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Listen Out Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

With 30,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Centennial Park. Thousands of people will also be attending a race day at nearby Royal Randwick Racecourse.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and expect delays on roads in the area.

Roads will be closed around Centennial Park and Moore Park precincts to allow attendees to safely leave the area.

From ​8pm​ to ​11pm​

  • ​​Driver Ave​ southbound onto Lang Rd
  • ​​Lang Rd westbound from ​Errol Flynn Blvd​ to Anzac Pde
  • ​​Moore Park Rd​ westbound from ​Oxford St​ to ​Lang Rd​ 

From ​9pm​ to ​11pm​

  • ​​Moore Park Rd​ eastbound from ​Oatley Rd​ to ​Oxford St​ 
  • Lang Rd between Anzac Pde and Errol Flynn Blvd 
  • Driver Ave northbound from Lang Rd

Managed access to Entertainment Quarter on Errol Flyn Blvd will be maintained via Cook Rd by traffic control.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 12pm until midnight on Driver Ave, and sections of Lang Rd and Oxford St. Clearways will be in effect on Cleveland St from 6am until midnight.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW Interactive road closure map - Sydney Marathon

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included for participants. Major bus diversions will be in place, plan ahead at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in Milsons Point, the City, Darlinghurst, Pyrmont, Moore Park and Centennial Park for the Sydney Marathon on Sunday 17 September. This year, the Sydney Marathon is an official candidate to become an Abbott World Marathon Major which requires changes to the event course; resulting in significant road closures and traffic impacts.

Sydney motorists are urged to avoid non-essential travel in areas around the course as long delays are expected with major detours in place.

The Harbour Bridge will close from 4am to 10am and major roads from the Opera House down to Moore Park will be closed until 2:30pm/3pm including Macquarie St, College St, Park St, Oxford St and Flinders St. Motorists will only be able to travel east/west across the course via the Cross City Tunnel which will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm on event day however long delays are expected and motorists should avoid non-essential travel.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 3:30am to 11am: roads at the start line in Milsons Point including Alfred St South.
  • 4am to 8:30am: roads in Millers Point and Barangaroo including sections of Watsons Rd, Upper Fort St and Argyle St.
  • 4am to 9:30am: roads in Pyrmont north including Bowman St and Pirrama Rd.
  • 4am to 10am: Sydney Harbour Bridge, Cahill Expressway, Western Distributor and some roads in Milsons Point and Pyrmont.
  • Southbound traffic approaching the Harbour Bridge will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel. Citybound traffic on the Anzac Bridge will be diverted via Bathurst St off-ramp. No direct access between the Anzac Bridge and Harbour Bridge until 10am. Motorists can use the Harbour Tunnel or Victoria Rd/Gladesville Bridge alternative routes.
  • The Harbour bridge cycleway and walkway remain open, trains continue to run across the bridge while its closed to traffic.
  • Note: Access to the Harbour Tunnel from the west is via the Cross City Tunnel only, no access via the city while major roads are closed. Drivers west of the city needing to travel north prior to 10am should use Victoria Rd/Gladesville Bridge.
  • 4am to 10:30am: roads in Millers Point including Hickson Rd, Dalgety Rd and Towns Place.
  • 4am to 11am: roads in The Rocks and Dawes Point including Hickson Rd and George St.
  • 4am to 2pm: roads in Moore Park including Moore Park Rd, Driver Ave. Centennial Park will also be closed to vehicles. Eastern Distributor Bondi Exit to Moore Park Rd will close from 2am - 4am and from 1:15pm - 2pm.
  • 4am to 2:30pm: Park St, College St, Oxford St and Flinders St from the city, Darlinghurst through to Moore Park.
  • Motorists will only be able to travel across the course via the Cross City Tunnel which will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm on event day however long delays are expected and motorists should avoid non-essential travel.
  • 4am to 3pm: roads in Sydney CBD east including Macquarie St, Bridge St, College St and Art Gallery Rd.
  • 5:30am to 11am: roads in Sydney CBD north and Circular Quay including Bridge St, Pitt St, Loftus St and Young St.
  • 6:30am to 12pm: Southbound lanes of Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd at Moore Park. Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde exit will also be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 1am to 3pm on major roads in the city, Pyrmont and Moore Park and from 12:15am to 11am on roads in Milsons Point and North Sydney.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

Kirribilli / Lavender Bay / Milsons Point / North Sydney

From 4am to 10am

  • Alfred St South between Olympic Dr and Paul St
  • Arthur St between Middlemiss St and Pacific Hwy
  • Bligh St between Humphrey Pl and Broughton St
  • Broughton St between Willoughby St and Olympic Dr
  • Ennis Rd from Broughton St
  • Fitzroy St between Jeffreys St and Broughton St
  • Kirribilli Ave between Jeffreys St and Broughton St
  • Lavender St between Cliff St and Alfred St South
  • Lavender St*1 between Walker St and Cliff St eastbound
  • Middlemiss St between Walker St and Lavender St
  • Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South westbound
  • Paul St between Alfred St Sth and Mary Wollstonecraft Ln

Notes:

*1 Lavender St remains open westbound to allow for residents to leave the area via Cliff St or Harbourview Cres. Paul St, Dind St, Glen St and Cliff St all closed at Alfred St South. Residents can exit from these roads only. No access allowed.

From 3:30am to 11am

  • Alfred St South between Paul St and Lavender St
  • Burton St between Alfred St South and Broughton St
  • Dind St between Alfred St Sth and Mary Wollstonecraft Ln
  • Fitzroy St between Alfred St South and Broughton St

Sydney Harbour Bridge and Approaches

From 4am to 10am

  • Bradfield Hwy / Sydney Harbour Bridge*2 all northbound and southbound lanes
  • Cahill Expressway between Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Domain Tunnel
  • Pacific Hwy between Bradfield Hwy and High St northbound
  • Warringah Freeway all access ramps and lanes to and from the Sydney Harbour Bridge
  • Western Distributor*3*26 all access ramps and lanes to and from the Sydney Harbour Bridge
  • Harbour St between Bathurst St and The Western Distributor
  • Harbour St between Day St and The Western Distributor northbound
  • Wheat Rd*9 Between Harbour St and Lime St

Notes:

*2 The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open in both directions during the event except for use by oversize vehicles or vehicles carrying dangerous goods. These vehicles will be detoured via the Gladesville Bridge and ANZAC Bridge when the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed. There is no direct access to the CBD via Eastern Distributor exits at Cowper Bay Wharf or Kings Cross exits throughout the day, drivers will need to use the Cross City Tunnel via William St

*3 The ANZAC Bridge will remain open in both directions during the event with the Western Distributor / Bathurst St exit ramp available to provide access to the western side of Sydney CBD and the Cross City Tunnel for access to the eastern suburbs and Sydney Harbour Tunnel. There is no direct access through the CBD for the eastern suburbs or Harbour Tunnel between 5am and 2pm.

*9 Erskine St will be closed between Shelley St and Sussex St from 5:00am to 8:30am. During this time access to and from King St Wharf area will be via Wheat Rd between 5:00am and 8:30am. From 8:30am vehicles exiting the area will be via Erskine Street

*26 The Cross City Tunnel will be Toll Free in both directions between 5am and 3pm

Sydney CBD East

From 4am to 3pm

  • Albert St*7 between Phillip St and Macquarie St
  • Art Gallery Rd between Hospital Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd
  • Bent St between Phillip St and Macquarie St
  • Bridge St*7 between Phillip St and Macquarie St
  • Cathedral St between St Marys Rd to end of street
  • College St between Prince Albert Rd and William St
  • Conservatorium Rd between Macquarie St and Cahill Expressway (including exit and entry ramp to Cahill Expressway)
  • Hunter St between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St eastbound
  • Hunter St between Macquarie St and Phillip St westbound
  • Hospital Rd*6 between Shakespeare Pl and Prince Albert Rd
  • Macquarie St between Sydney Opera House and St James Rd
  • Mrs Macquaries Rd from Art Gallery Rd
  • Phillip Ln between Phillip Ln and Macquarie St
  • Prince Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • Shakespeare Pl*8 between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • St Marys Rd between Yurong Parkway and Prince Albert Rd
  • Yurong Parkway Between William St and St Marys Rd Northbound

Notes:

*6 Between 4am and 3pm access to Hospital Rd will be via two-way contra flow at Shakespeare Pl. At all other times access to Hospital Rd will be via traffic control at St Marys Rd.

*7 Local access from Albert St, Loftus Ln, Phillip Ln, the Intercontinental Hotel, the Sir Stamford Hotel and Quay Grand Suites will be via traffic control at Bridge St and Phillip St between 5:30am and 7am and 10:30am and 11am. There will be no access from 7am to 10:30am. Directions to vehicles will be via Police & traffic controllers in the area.

*8 Shakespeare Pl remains a crossover point for eastbound and westbound traffic until 5am.

Pyrmont

From 4am to 9:30am

  • Bank St between Bowman St and Quarry Master Drive
  • Bowman St between Cross St and Bank St
  • Cadigal Ave*21 between Bowman St and John St
  • Darling Island Rd*22 from Pirrama Rd
  • Fyfe St*22 between Darling Island Rd and Wharf Cres
  • Harris St between John St and northern end of Harris St
  • Harvey St*21 between Mount St Walk and Harris St
  • Jones Bay Rd*23 between Pyrmont St and Pirrama Rd
  • Jones Bay Wharf *27 From Pirrama Rd
  • Jones St*21 between Bowman St and John St
  • Mount St Walk *21 between Harvey St and Refinery Dr
  • Pirrama Rd between Jones Bay Rd and Harris St
  • Refinery Dr*21 between Bowman St and Mount St Walk
  • Tambua St*21 between Bowman St and Distillery Dr
  • Trouton Pl from Darling Island Rd
  • Wharf Cres*22 between Darling Island Rd and Darling Island Rd

Notes:

*21 Resident access available from 4am to 7am. Access to Refinery Drive available if suitable gaps in marathon race. Directions to vehicles will be given by Police and Traffic Controllers in the area.

*22 Resident access maintained from 4am to 6:30am under directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police. There will be no resident access from 6:30am to 9:30am.

*23 Access to The Star Taxi & Hire Car Plaza maintained.

*27 Access from Mill St available at all times

 Pyrmont / Darling Harbour / Ultimo

From 4am to 10:00am

  • Australian National Maritime Museum Driveway at Murray St
  • Darling Drive between Murray St and Pier St
  • Darling Drive between Ultimo Rd and Pier St northbound
  • Edward Ln between Little Edward St and Pyrmont St
  • Edward St between Union St and Pyrmont Bridge R
  • Harwood St between Union Ln and Pyrmont Bridge Rd
  • Iron Wharf Place Between Darling Drive and Darling Drive
  • Little Edward St between Edward Ln and Pyrmont Bridge Rd

  • Union St between Edward St and Murray St

  • Zollner Circuit *28 from Darling Drive

Notes:

*20 Exit from the Star to occur from Edward St.

*22 Wharf 10, and Darling Island resident access permitted to and from Jones Bay Road between 4am & 6:30am and 9:30am to 10:00am under the direction of traffic controllers and NSW Police. There will be no resident access from 6:30am to 9:30am.

*24 Resident access to driveways on western side of Pyrmont St maintained during the event under the direction of Traffic Controllers between 4am and 7am and 8:30am and 10am. No access between 7am and 8:30am

*28 PMNSW Access maintained via contraflow from Darling Drive

Barangaroo / Millers Point

From 4am to 8:30am

  • Argyle Place between Dalgetty St and Kent St eastbound
  • Argyle St Between Kent St and Lower Fort St 
  • Dalgety Rd*14 between Windmill St and Argyle Place eastbound

*10 During the Harbour Bridge closure from 4am to 10am, access to Wheat Rd for Cockle Bay Wharf tenants, residents and deliveries will be via traffic control on Harbour St at Day St. Exiting the area will be via two-way traffic control on Wheat Rd between 5:00am and 8:30am. From 8:30am vehicles entering and exiting will be via Erskine Street

There will be no access from 7am to 10:30am. Directions to vehicles will be via Police & traffic controllers in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Special Event Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Speed Zone Reductions

Sydney CBD

  • Speed reduced to 40km/h from 4:00am to 10:00am on Harbour St between Shelley St and Bathurst St

Surry Hills

  • Speed reduced to 30km/h from 4:00am to 2:30pm on Albion St between Bourke St and Flinders St
arrangementElements.title: Speed limit reductions

arrangementElements.html:
CIRCULAR QUAY

Road closures:

  • Macquarie St from the Opera House to Hyde Park will be closed from 4am - 3pm.  
  • Roads north of Bridge St including Pitt, Loftus, Young and Phillip Streets will be closed from 5:30am - 11am.

Managed access:

Sydney Opera House car park: No entry after 5am, exit only via Macquarie St, Albert St & Phillip St until 5:30am under Traffic Controller / NSW Police direction.

  • Managed EXIT will be permitted for vehicles from properties on Albert St and Phillip St. No entry permitted.
  • Exit via Phillip St at Bridge St southbound from 5:30am-7am and 10:30am-11am only.
  • NOTE: Runners on Bridge St from 7:30am – 10:15am 
  • Managed entry into Albert St from 11am – 3pm. No access into Macquarie St 

EASTERN SUBURBS

Major roads will be closed restricting access east/west across the course from the Opera House, through the city, Darlinghurst down to Moore Park.

Key roads will be closed between 4am and 2:30pm/3pm including:

  • Park St / William St between Elizabeth St and Crown St
  • Oxford St from Liverpool St to Flinders St
  • Flinders St from Oxford St to Moore Park Rd
  • College St between Macquarie St and Oxford St
  • Macquarie St from the Opera House to Hyde Park

For drivers needing to travel east/west across the course on event day during these hours, the only available route is via the Cross City Tunnel. The tunnel will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm. Long delays are expected so motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel, and if you do need to drive allow for plenty of extra travel time on the roads. Alternative detour to travel east/west across the course is around Centennial Park via York Rd and Alison Rd during closures.

MOORE PARK AND CENTENNIAL PARK

Major roads will be closed restricting access east/west across the course from the Opera House, through the city, Darlinghurst down to Moore Park.

Sections of Macquarie St, College St, Park St, Oxford St and Flinders St will be closed between 4am and 3pm.

For drivers needing to travel east/west across the course on event day during these hours, the only available route is via the Cross City Tunnel. The tunnel will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm. Long delays are expected so motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel, and if you do need to drive allow for plenty of extra travel time on the roads.

Alternative detour to travel east/west across the course is around Centennial Park via York Rd and Alison Rd during closures.

Road closures and local access

  • Centennial Park: from 4am to 2pm there will be no access for vehicles or cyclists, and no equestrian access. Only pedestrian access to the park will be permitted.
  • Entertainment Quarter: from 4:30am-1:30pm access to the precinct is via Lang Rd at Oxford St from the east. No access via Anzac Pde or Lang Rd at Cleveland St. Note: contingency closures may be implemented on Lang Rd at Oxford St – should this be closed access to the Entertainment Quarter will be via Oxford St, Oatley Rd, Moore Park Rd, and Cook Rd only.  
  • Eastern Distributor off-ramp closures Randwick and Bondi: The Randwick exit to Anzac Pde exit will be closed from 6:30am to 12pm, exit via Bondi during this time. The Bondi exit to Moore Park Rd will be closed from 2am to 4am and 1:15pm to 2pm. Use the Randwick Anzac Pde exit during these times.

Moore Park:

  • From 4am to 2pm Moore Park Rd will be closed westbound from Lang Rd to Anzac Pde including Driver Ave. Moore Park Rd remains open eastbound from Greens Rd to Oxford St.
  • From 4am to 1:30pm Lang Rd closed at Anzac Pde Cleveland St. Vehicle crossover at Cleveland St and Lang Rd will remain open until 5am only.
  • From 6.30am – 12pm: Anzac Pde closed southbound from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd. Note Anzac Pde from 12pm this section of Anzac Pde is only accessible via the Eastern Distributor due to closures on Flinders St until 2:30pm.
  • Robertson Rd properties: Residents in Robertson Rd, Martin Rd, Oxley Ln and Dibbs St have managed access/exit only during the below times. Residents can park in the Entertainment Quarter – the event will issue a reimbursement if conditions from the reimbursement form are met. 4:00am – 6:00am, 7:30am – 8:15am and 12:30pm – 1:30pm.

PYRMONT

The following key roads in Pyrmont and Darling Harbour will be closed:

  • From 4am to 9:30am: roads in the northern end of Pyrmont including Pirrama Rd, Bowman St, Refinery Dr and Darling Island Rd.
  • From 4am to 10am: roads in the southern end of Pyrmont and Darling Harbour including sections of Pyrmont St, Pirrama Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd and the Pyrmont on-ramp to the Western Distributor.
  • The Western Distributor between Pyrmont and the CBD including on/off ramps will be closed from 4am to 10am. Citybound traffic from the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst St off ramp.
  • Access to areas north of the Harbour Bridge: from 4am to 10am motorists travelling north of the Harbour Bridge will need to travel via the Cross City Tunnel eastbound towards Kings Cross (toll-free from 5am – 3pm) and join the Eastern Distributor via the Bayswater Rd entry portal to continue on the Harbour Tunnel northbound. Expect heavy delays. 
  • Access to Eastern Distributor travelling south: motorists can access the Eastern Distributor via the Cross City Tunnel eastbound (toll-free from 5am – 3pm).

Managed local access:

  • Refinery Dr properties: managed entry and exit will be permitted via Tambua St from 4am-7am and 9am-9:30am under traffic control. Alternative parking for residents within road closures will be available at the Dragon Boat car park. Open from 4pm Sat 16 Sep until 11am Sun 17 Sep.
  • The Star car park: from 4am-10am entry & exit via Edward St only. Access to the taxi rank/valet parking on Jones Bay Rd maintained via Pyrmont St.   
  • Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour & ibis Sydney Darling Harbour: access via Murray St south from Allen St. 
  • Darling Island Rd properties: Managed access available for Darling Island Rd properties until 6:30am only. Entry/exit via Pyrmont St and Jones Bay Rd.
  • Wharf 10 Pyrmont: Managed access until 6:30am via Pyrmont St, Jones Bay Rd and Pirrama Rd. 

THE ROCKS/ WALSH BAY/MILLERS POINT/BARANGAROO RESERVE

Key roads in Millers Point, The Rocks and Walsh Bay will be closed between 4am and 11am.  

  • From 4am to 8:30am: Lower Fort St, Argyle Place and Argyle St
  • From 4am to 10:30am: Hickson Rd closed from Napoleon St to Pottinger St.
  • From 4am to 11am: Hickson Rd/George St closed from Pottinger St down to Essex St.

Note, The Rocks Markets closures: George St between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St will be closed from 2pm Fri 15 Sept - 1am Mon 18 Sept

Managed local access:

  • Resident access for Merriman St, Bettington St and Rodens Ln will be via two-way traffic arrangements along Kent St only.
  • Resident access for Windmill St, Lower Fort St, Argyle Place and Trinity Ave will be via Cumberland St or Harrington St.  
  • There will be northbound access on Hickson Rd from 4am to 10:30am to Pottinger St or until 11am for access to The Rocks. Use Kent St or Clarence St.
  • Barangaroo Reserve Car Park maintains access via two-way traffic on Dalgety Rd and Kent St.

Milsons Point / North Sydney

Key roads around the event start area in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay, North Sydney, and Kirribilli will be closed between 3:30am and 11am including sections of Alfred St South, Olympic Dr, Fitzroy St, Lavender St and Broughton St.  

The Sydney Harbour Bridge, Cahill Expressway, and Western Distributor will be closed in both directions from 4am to 10am.

Southbound traffic approaching the Harbour Bridge will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel. During this time there is no direct vehicle access to the CBD due to major closures in the city east. Residents that need to access the CBD before 10am are encouraged to catch trains instead for a more direct and faster route and avoid traffic delays on detour routes.

Motorists can access the Sydney Harbour Tunnel via the Neutral Bay Falcon St or Military Rd on-ramps. Heavy traffic is expected so motorists are strongly encouraged to delay non-essential travel until after 10am. After 10am use the Tunnel for access to the east/Airport or the Harbour Bridge for the CBD and west.

  • Managed local access Milsons Point: due to large crowds at the start area there is no vehicle access to properties on roads west of Alfred St South from 4am – 10am. Vehicles can continue to exit the area during this time via Cliff St and Lavender St westbound under traffic control.

KING ST WHARF / BARANGAROO SOUTH / COCKLE BAY WHARF

Key roads including Erskine St, Hickson Rd, Sussex St and Napoleon St will be closed between 4am and 8:30am.

Managed local access:

  • To King St Wharf, Cockle Bay Wharf and Barangaroo South: From 5am and 8:30am entry and exit via Wheat Rd, access from Harbour St. After 8:30am entry and exit via Erskine St.
  • Access to properties/car parks on Sussex St between Erskine St and King St will be available under traffic control during the road closures. Access via Kent St & Erskine St intersection only.
  • No northbound access on Hickson Rd between 4am and 10:30am. Use Kent St or Clarence St.

SYDNEY HOSPITAL

  • From 4am to 3pm – access to Sydney Hospital, and Hospital Rd will be two-way via Shakespeare Place only. Access via Sir John Young Cr or Palmer St. No access via St Marys Rd during this time.
  • Note: Local access to Cathedral St available via St Marys Rd from 4am to 3pm.
  • Vehicle crossover: Traffic will be able to cross the course east/west via Bent St and Shakespeare Place until 5am only. After this time, east/west access is via Cross City Tunnel only.
arrangementElements.title: Changed local access arrangements

roads.mainStreet: Sydney Harbour Bridge, Western Distributor, Park Street, Oxford Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Milsons Point, Darlinghurst, Pyrmont, Moore Park

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Bathurst NAIDOC Week Street March will be held on Monday 18 September 2023. The march will start at 10:00am and proceed west along William Street before turning right into Russell Street where it will finish in Kings parade Park near the Council Chambers. To facilitate the commencement of the march, there will be no access into William Street from the Great Western Highway (Durham St) for up to 20 minutes.

The westbound left turn lane from the Great Western Highway into William Street and the eastbound right turn lane from the Great Western Highway into William Street will both be closed to prevent highway traffic entering William Street. The closures will only be in place for a short duration (up to 20 minutes) whilst the march contingent forms up, commences the march and passes through and clears the next intersection

(Howick Street). NSW Police will assist by implementing a 'rolling closure'. Traffic lights at the intersection of Great Western Highway and William Street will operate as per normal to minimise impacts to highway traffic.

The PBR Monster Energy Tour Maitland will be held on Saturday 16 September at 7pm at the Maitland Showground. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event.

The Living Smart Festival will be held on Saturday 16 to Sunday 17 September from 9am to 2pm both days. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event.

The Aboriginal Rugby League Knockout Tournament will be held on Friday 15 to Sunday 17 September at Oaks Oval in Lismore. Dawson Street will be closed between Rural Street and Magellan Street and Magellan Street to Cathcart Street. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.
properties.diversions: A detour will be in place via Diadem Street and Uralba Street.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Women's double header at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Roosters v Cowboys kick-off at 6pm. Dragons v Broncos kick-off at 8:10pm, full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

webLinks.linkText: Granny Smith Festival - Ryde Council website

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 515, 521, 544 and 555 will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Granny Smith Festival, running from 9am until 8:30pm. The event will be held along Rowe Street, Progress Avenue and Hillview Road from 9am to 3.30pm, Eastwood Plaza from 9am to 5.30pm and Eastwood Oval from 9am to 8.30pm, with fireworks at 8pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic in the area will be heavier than usual while closures and local traffic detours are in place.

Local roads will close between 5pm Friday and 10pm Saturday including sections of Rowe St, Trelawney St, Progress Ave, Hillview Rd, Lakeside Rd, Shaftsbury Rd, Glen St and Richards Ave.

Motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Lakeside Road, Glen Street, Shaftsbury Road and Rowe Street

properties.otherAdvice:
The Henty Machinery Field Days Tuesday will be held from 19 to Thursday 21 September and is one of the largest exhibitions of agricultural machinery and associated products in rural Australia. The event attracts in excess of 800 exhibitors and more than 60,000 people during the three-day event.

Access to the event is via a single road (Henty-Cookardinia Road).

Traffic controllers will be on-site to direct motorists.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on the Olympic Hwy at Cookardinia Rd.

A speed reduction will be in place on the Olympic Hwy, check signage and exercise caution in the area.

Motorists are advised to allow approximately 20 minutes of additional travel time.

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Redfern and Green Square Stations to the Venue. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Marathon Running Show will be held from Thu to Sat at The Venue, 55 Doody St Alexandria. Opening Hours on Thu 8am - 8pm, Fri 8am - 8pm and Sat 8am - 5pm.

Thousands of marathon participants will travel to and from the expo to collect their bibs for race day on Sun 17 Sep.

Traffic is expected to be heavy in the area particularly during weeknight peaks.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and expect delays on roads in the area including O'Riordan St, Doody St and Bourke Rd.

Parking is limited, attendees are encouraged to use public transport.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Tony Robbins – Unleash the Power Within show at Qudos Bank Arena from Thursday 14 to Sunday 17 September. Event runs 9:30am to midnight Thursday, 9:30am to 9:30pm Friday, 8:15am to 11:30pm Saturday and from 8:30am to 8pm Sunday.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct, particularly during weekday peak travel times and over the weekend while an Expo also takes place within the precinct. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Ride Wollongong Festival of Cycling will include races, live entertainment and market stalls.

Motorists are advised to take caution in the area with increased pedestrian activity.

Local detours will be in place.

The Bathurst Edgell Jog will take place on Sunday 17 September 2023.

Lambert Street and Russell Street intersections on the Great Western Highway (Stewart St) will be reduced to

one lane in all directions and manually managed using traffic controllers. As Lambert Street is a signalised

intersection, all lanterns will be set to flash yellow. There will be intermittent stopages between 9:00am and

11:00 to allow participants to cross the highway safely. Bentinck Street at Russell Street will also be under

traffic control to allow partipants to cross through the intersection unimpeded

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL & NRLW Grand Final at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open from 1pm with preliminary matches from 1:20pm. NRL Women's Grand Final kick-off at 3:55pm, followed by Men's NRL Grand Final kicking off at 7:30pm, with full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as up to 80,000 fans travel to the stadium for the match.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game between 7pm Saturday 30 Oct and 3am Monday 2 Oct. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice: Up to 10,000 people per day are expected to attend the 51st annual NSW Aboriginal Rugby League Koori Knockout tournament at the Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex in Tuggerah from Friday to Monday, 8am to 6pm daily. Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on the Pacific Hwy, Wyong Rd, Bryant Dr and Pacific Mwy as crowds travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads in the area during the already busy long weekend period and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in Tuggerah.
properties.displayName: NSW Aboriginal Rugby League Koori Knockout

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW: Wests Tigers v Knights at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 7:45pm, full time approx 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
